faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain, including EU and non-EU citizens. Spain welcomes international property investment with minimal restrictions. Non-residents should obtain a Spanish tax identification number (NIE). Our team can guide you through all legal requirements and documentation needed for your ORQUIDEA purchase.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property price, costs typically include: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5-1%), land registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and legal fees (1-3%). For ORQUIDEA properties starting from €214,000, total acquisition costs generally range from 10-15% of the purchase price. We provide detailed cost breakdowns during the consultation process.

faqs.question: What are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spain's property taxes include annual IBI (property tax) based on property value, typically 0.4-1.1% annually, and rental income tax if you lease your property. Non-resident property owners pay 19% capital gains tax on profit. The specific taxes for your ORQUIDEA villa depend on individual circumstances. Our advisors provide personalized tax guidance.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property purchase in Spain doesn't require a visa; you can buy as a visitor. However, if you plan to reside in Spain, you may need appropriate visa documentation. EU citizens enjoy freedom of movement and residence. Non-EU buyers should consult Spanish immigration authorities regarding residency requirements. Our team assists with all legal and administrative processes.
